Package testing

Class OurDLinkedList

java.lang.Object
testing.OurDLinkedList
public class OurDLinkedList extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    OurDLinkedList()
    Constructs an empty doubly linked list.

  • Constructor Details

    • OurDLinkedList

      public OurDLinkedList()
      Constructs an empty doubly linked list. Initializes the head and tail references to null and the size to 0.

  • Method Details

    • getHead

      public testing.OurDLinkedList.Node getHead()
      Retrieves the head of the doubly linked list.
      Returns:
      The head node of the list.

    • getNext

      public testing.OurDLinkedList.Node getNext(testing.OurDLinkedList.Node current)
      Retrieves the next node after the given node in the linked list.
      Parameters:
      current - The current node whose next node is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The next node after the given node, or null if the current node is null or the last node.

    • addAtHead

      public void addAtHead(String newValue)
      Adds a new node with the given value at the head of the doubly linked list.
      Parameters:
      newValue - The value to be added at the head of the list.

    • addAtTail

      public void addAtTail(String newValue)
      Adds a new node with the given value at the tail of the doubly linked list.
      Parameters:
      newValue - The value to be added at the tail of the list.

    • addAfter

      public void addAfter(String referenceValue, String newValue)
      Adds a new node with the given value after the node containing the specified reference value in the doubly linked list. If the reference value is not found, or the list is empty, no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      referenceValue - The value after which the new node is to be added.
      newValue - The value to be added after the reference value.

    • getWordsForTopic

      public testing.OurLinkedList getWordsForTopic(String topic)
      Retrieves the linked list containing words for the specified topic.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic for which the linked list of words is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The linked list containing words for the specified topic, or null if the topic is not found.

    • addBefore

      public void addBefore(String referenceValue, String newValue)
      Adds a new node with the given value before the node containing the specified reference value in the doubly linked list. If the reference value is not found, or the list is empty, no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      referenceValue - The value before which the new node is to be added.
      newValue - The value to be added before the reference value.

    • removeHead

      public String removeHead()
      Removes the head node from the doubly linked list and returns its value. If the list is empty, returns null.
      Returns:
      The value of the head node that has been removed, or null if the list is empty.

    • removeTail

      public String removeTail()
      Removes the tail node from the doubly linked list and returns its value. If the list is empty, returns null.
      Returns:
      The value of the tail node that has been removed, or null if the list is empty.

    • removeValue

      public String removeValue(String topic)
      Removes the node containing the specified topic from the doubly linked list and returns its value. If the list is empty or the topic is not found, returns null.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic to be removed from the list.
      Returns:
      The value of the removed node, or null if the list is empty or the topic is not found.

    • modifyWordNode

      public void modifyWordNode(String topic, String oldWord, String newWord)
      Modifies a word node within the specified topic. If the topic or the old word is not found, prints a message accordingly.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic in which the word node is to be modified.
      oldWord - The old word to be replaced.
      newWord - The new word to replace the old word.

    • addWordToTopic

      public void addWordToTopic(String topic)
      Adds a word to the specified topic in the doubly linked list. If the topic is not found, prints a message accordingly.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic to which the word is to be added.

    • getWordsStartingWithLetter

      public ArrayList<String> getWordsStartingWithLetter(char letter)
      Retrieves a list of words starting with the specified letter from all topics in the doubly linked list.
      Parameters:
      letter - The starting letter of the words to retrieve.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing words starting with the specified letter from all topics.

    • searchWord

      public String searchWord(String word)
      Searches for a specified word in the topics and returns the topic containing the word. If the word is found, returns the topic; otherwise, returns null.
      Parameters:
      word - The word to search for.
      Returns:
      The topic containing the specified word, or null if the word is not found.

    • extractWordsStartingWithLetter

      public ArrayList<String> extractWordsStartingWithLetter(char letter)
      Extracts words starting with the specified letter from all topics and stores them in an ArrayList. The extracted words are sorted alphabetically.
      Parameters:
      letter - The starting letter of the words to extract.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing words starting with the specified letter from all topics, sorted alphabetically.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the number of elements (topics) in the doubly linked list.
      Returns:
      The number of elements (topics) in the list.

    • displayForward

      public void displayForward()
      Displays the topics in the doubly linked list in forward order. If the list is empty, prints a message indicating so.

    • displayBackward

      public void displayBackward()
      Displays the topics in the doubly linked list in backward order. If the list is empty, prints a message indicating so.

    • getTopics

      public String[] getTopics()
      Retrieves the topics from the doubly linked list and returns them as an array of strings.
      Returns:
      An array of strings containing the topics stored in the list.

    • displayTopicContent

      public void displayTopicContent(String chosenTopic)
      Displays the content of the specified topic. If the topic is found, prints the content of the topic including each word. If the topic is not found or has no content, prints an appropriate message.
      Parameters:
      chosenTopic - The topic for which to display the content.

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile(String fileName)
      Saves all content (topics and their words) to a file. Each topic is prefixed with '#' and followed by its associated words. Topics are separated by a blank line.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file to which the content will be saved.

    • findNodeByTopic

      public testing.OurDLinkedList.Node findNodeByTopic(String topic)
      Finds the node in the doubly linked list with the specified topic.
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic to search for.
      Returns:
      The node containing the specified topic, or null if the topic is not found.
